paragraphs.name: ea03
paragraphs.text: My initial thoughts were to handle save folks a few steps by automating the installer. If everyone ran the same commands, then we could cut down on human error (skipping a command, typos, etc.). I also wanted to be mindful that people might be switching from either Bash or an existing cobbled-together Zsh configuration. To help them with a possible switch back to the previous shell, we made a backup of their original configuration file. Finally, we’d switch their default shell to Zsh.

Currently, we have plugins for adb, ant, apache2-macports, archlinux, autoenv, autojump, autopep8, aws, battery, bbedit, bgnotify, boot2docker, bower, branch, brew, brew-cask, bundler, bwana, cabal, cake, cakephp3, capistrano, cask, catimg, celery, chruby, chucknorris, cloudapp, codeclimate, coffee, colemak, colored-man-pages, colorize, command-not-found, common-aliases, compleat, composer, copydir, copyfile, cp, cpanm, debian, dircycle, dirhistory, dirpersist, django, dnf, docker, docker-compose, emacs, ember-cli, emoji, emoji-clock, emotty, encode64, extract, fabric, fancy-ctrl-z, fasd, fastfile, fbterm, fedora, forklift, frontend-search, gas, gem, git, git-extras, git-flow, git-flow-avh, git-hubflow, git-prompt, git-remote-branch, gitfast, github, gitignore, glassfish, gnu-utils, go, golang, gpg-agent, gradle, grails, grunt, gulp, heroku, history, history-substring-search, httpie, iwhois, jake-node, jhbuild, jira, jruby, jsontools, jump, kate, kitchen, knife, knife_ssh, laravel, laravel4, laravel5, last-working-dir, lein, lighthouse, lol, macports, man, marked2, mercurial, meteor, mix, mix-fast, mosh, mvn, mysql-macports, n98-magerun, nanoc, nmap, node, npm, nvm, nyan, osx, pass, paver, pep8, per-directory-history, perl, phing, pip, pj, pod, postgres, pow, powder, powify, profiles, pyenv, pylint, python, rails, rake, rake-fast, rand-quote, rbenv, rbfu, rebar, redis-cli, repo, rsync, ruby, rvm, safe-paste, sbt, scala, scd, screen, scw, sfffe, singlechar, spring, sprunge, ssh-agent, stack, sublime, sudo, supervisor, suse, svn, svn-fast-info, symfony, symfony2, systemadmin, systemd, taskwarrior, terminalapp, terminitor, terraform, textastic, textmate, thefuck, themes, thor, tmux, tmux-cssh, tmuxinator, torrent, tugboat, ubuntu, urltools, vagrant, vault, vi-mode, vim-interaction, virtualenv, virtualenvwrapper, vundle, wakeonlan, wd, web-search, wp-cli, xcode, yii, yii2, yum, z, zeus, zsh-navigation-tools, zsh_reload.
Where do all these new users keep coming from? I ❤ you people!

c58a0643b817.title: spawned oh-my-fish too, which I contributed to for a while.

paragraphs.text: spawned oh-my-fish too, which I contributed to for a while. thanks for starting a great community :)
I really love it. I hadn’t used the terminal much before volunteering to do a JavaScript app (something else I hadn’t done before), and Wes Bos got me onto oh-my-zsh via some of his posts.

paragraphs.text: I’m a happy convert to OMZ! It took a little bit to fix my .bash_profile issues and get my PATH straightened. Life is good! I sure have a purty command line now! Thanks for the history on the project. It’s amazing how something just grows! Cheers!

9b739282bc9e.title: I can distinctly remember the first time I sat down in front of a Bourne shell, in April of 1980.

paragraphs.text: I can distinctly remember the first time I sat down in front of a Bourne shell, in April of 1980. I was amazed at what I could do with it, and spent over 35 years with it; at first, revelling in it and then, later, automating the crap out of it so I had to do as little as possible in it.

a61ff8d72fb9.title: Oh My Zsh is the main reason I even use zsh.

paragraphs.text: Oh My Zsh is the main reason I even use zsh. I’d been a bash person for years and saw no compelling reason to change, until someone showed my OMZ. Thank you for making my day to day command-line life significantly better!
paragraphs.name: b9cc

31a2871272f7.title: I stopped using omz because of some very slow prompt color mechanism.

paragraphs.text: I stopped using omz because of some very slow prompt color mechanism. I too had my ‘meh they suxx’ but I didn’t have twitter at the time. Luckily, because in retrospect I feel it’s pretty violent. I wouldn’t like to take anger from random people for a bunch of code I published. OMZ was nice, it’s cool to see how it was born and grew, thanks for the work. Good luck with the rest.
paragraphs.name: 03dd

paragraphs.text: Thanks for creating zsh! I use it everday and recommending it to everyone (who works in a terminal :))
